channel.title: Tech Question
channel.description: Hello, my HP laptop's power cord isn't working. I have a compaq nc6230, my other power cord (nc6000) is ripped and doesn't work. Anyways, mine wasn't working, so i switched the plug part that goes into the wall (that connects to the battery pack. But, when I moved my laptop, the power cord moved and stopped working. I have tried the same thing to fix it, but I cannot. Also, it makes a beeping noise which apparently my parents cannot hear (only when its plugged in, of course.) Please Help! Thanks :) Justis

item.title: Tech Question
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Also, make sure you are using a surge protector, in severe cases, your laptop can fry.

Read full topic

item.title: Tech Question
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

just got a new power cord instead, works fine

Read full topic

item.title: Tech Question
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“shadow235, post:3, topic:96951”]I’m not very skilled at labtops, but maby its were the connection between the cord and the labtop is. It might be messed up. Buy a can of compressed hair a blow dirt and crap outa there.[/quote] the connection fault would more likely be in the cord so that it would only work if its in a certain possition iff at all. altho its common with earphones i havent seen this happen to any fairly thick cords.

try looking
http://www.sparepartswarehouse.com/Compaq,Computer,Power-Cords.aspx

Read full topic

item.description:
@shadow235 wrote:

I’m not very skilled at labtops, but maby its were the connection between the cord and the labtop is. It might be messed up. Buy a can of compressed hair a blow dirt and crap outa there.

item.title: Tech Question
item.dc:creator: @hodunken hodunken
item.description:
@hodunken wrote:

I had a similar problem on my mom laptop…

We never really found out what the problem was exactly but we did have to replace the part the cord goes into on the computer…(sorry I don’t know the name of the part)

Some guy said I probably was cause by a power serge. plugging in and unplugging your laptop without a serge protector can really cause some wear and tare on your comp.

I’m not saying this is what happen to you, but its a possibility

Read full topic

item.title: Tech Question
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Hello, my HP laptop’s power cord isn’t working. I have a compaq nc6230, my other power cord (nc6000) is ripped and doesn’t work. Anyways, mine wasn’t working, so i switched the plug part that goes into the wall (that connects to the battery pack.
But, when I moved my laptop, the power cord moved and stopped working. I have tried the same thing to fix it, but I cannot. Also, it makes a beeping noise which apparently my parents cannot hear (only when its plugged in, of course.)
Please Help!
Thanks
Justis

Read full topic
